website_summaries.verdict: This is the best cable modem you can buy if you subscribe to gigabit service from your ISP.
pros: It's fast, and backwards-compatible with DOCSIS 3.0 connections
It's also incredibly durable, so it'll last for years
cons: It's expensive, and some Comcast users have reported occasional disconnection issues

website_summaries.verdict: If you can get over the initial cost, this ultra high-speed cable modem may be the best choice for heavy internet users, Netflix binge-watchers, Xbox players, and anyone who works from home.
pros: Can deliver over 1 Gigabit per second
Excellent high-speed internet for online gaming, video streaming, and general internet usage
Certified by Comcast and Cox Communications
cons: This model is one of the most expensive cable modems available from Motorola

customer_reviews.title: easy setup.  fast. future proof!
customer_reviews.text: connected pc directly to modem and did the activation online. super fast activated on comcast in under 5 min. after i activated the modem i connected my router and away i went. internet now is more snappy. i moved from a zoom 5341h(4x4 modem) im on the blast tier and am seeing 230 meg down x 13 meg upload signals on my older modem were at +1 power on 4 downstream channels with an snr of 37 upstream power stayed the same. as you can see with attached picture my snr greatly improved with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: A Keeper
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Runs great, uses Broadcom chipset. Small. Reasonably priced. 32x8. Modem admin name is changeable. Can do up to 4 bound ethernet ports for 4gpbs if you can afford it. LEDs are not bright, and only the ethernet one blinks occasionally. Comes with a wrench for tightening coaxial heads. Cons: Instructions say to go to xfinity.com/internetsetup but it doesn't load, you actually want /activate. Before realizing this, I tried to activate remotely from my xfinity account and it said activated, but it wasn't. Overall opinion: There is no competition right now.
customer_reviews.author: Responsible User

customer_reviews.title: Don't Even Consider
customer_reviews.text: The first Modem failed just after the warranty period (2 yrs), I was thankful I purchased an extended Square Trade warranty. Sent it to them for repair...wasn't repairable, I was reimbursed. With that money, I purchased a replacement, thinking I just received a bad unit. The replacement modem failed after only 3 months (july, 2 - Sept 30, 2019). Th failure duplicated that of the first modem?! This modem is absolute trash. I initiated a warranty claim with Motorola and wondering what they're going to put me through...not a happy camper!!
customer_reviews.author: wspirit119

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be reset every few days
customer_reviews.text: Every few days this modem stops working. The lights on the modem stay on (blue for DOCSIS 3.1), and the link light is blinking, but there is no connection. Can't even access the modem's admin interface (192.168.100.1). The router is working fine when this happens (I can access other computers on the network). Turning the modem off/on fixes the problem (it's able establish a connection pretty quickly after resetting, 2 minutes or so). The event log in the admin interface doesn't have anything logged. Power and SNR all seem to be within appropriate ranges.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Al-u-min-ium

customer_reviews.title: Almost useless - fails 1 to 6 times a day
customer_reviews.text: I am seeing the same issue as others where the link light blinks rapidly and I lose connection to the internet. At the same time the modem administration page is inaccessible. I am beyond the return period and I'll probably just eat the cost and buy a modem from another maker. Too bad, Motorola used to be a brand that you could count on. Update: Replaced this with a Netgear CM1000 and my connection is now rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: Daily reboots
customer_reviews.text: Total disappointment. I bought this as an 'upgrade' for my Cox ultimate internet service. This modem required daily reboots and I experienced constant loss of service. I returned this and reinstalled my rock solid Arris. Amazon provided excellent customer service for the return.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Like a Boss
customer_reviews.text: I had another modem That went on and off, you see Connections dropped, it torqued me off A more reliable one was for me! I saw this had that DOCSIS 3.1 Which makes this unit FAST And so far, I am glad to say, My internet connections last! They ask to rate the WiFi But I guess they just don't get That a Modem's not a router So there is no WiFi net. I haven't used the tech support And so I cannot rate it But isn't that a plus - to buy a thing And not hate it?
customer_reviews.author: Oogie Pringle

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money or time
customer_reviews.text: outdated, over priced and frankly not worthy of the Motorola brand name 1) can't disable NAT 2) NO FIREWALL configuration what so ever 3) can't even configure or disable DHCP for LAN or WAN side 6) can't do MAC cloning 7) documentation is non existant simple plain Jane bottom drawer modem. price should be less than $50 I expected more from a strong name. I guess Motorola has given up even trying anymore
customer_reviews.author: Tough Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fraud!!! Do not buy! Warranty not honored! Poor support!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fraud!!! Modem lasted 5 months and started locking up so bad I could not bring up the admin web page. Now support wants me to hook the modem back up to troubleshoot and doesn’t trust my claims the modem was locking up. Don’t buy, they’ll make and attempts to replace very difficult and not worth your time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Docsis 3.1 modem works flawlessly on Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to the replace my first gen Motorola Docsis 3.0 modem after upgrading comcast service. Upgrade was painless and did it on my own without needing to call anyone in support to ease that pain. Registered modem and good to go. This is currently the best spec'ed Docsis 3.1 modem on the market--after a lot of research (compared to Netgear and Arris's top of the line offerings). Either of the 3 top modems by said companies are good--but the Motorola unit slightly edges the others out with a better equipment chipset inside. As a side note: it does have an internal webserver like other motorola products with diagnostics and testing capabilities which is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: MattM (me mums says i'ma genius)

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend with Comcast/Xfinity.
customer_reviews.text: Read through some of the more thoughtful posts here and I agree with many of the statements, this product is iffy at best. I'm not technical enough to get into details, but after trying to make this work, several hours spent on the phone and a visit from a Comcast tech the modem does fine right after activation but once it has a signal issue it grounds to a halt. It should not be recommended for use on their network. Pity that Motorola has come to this.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Storey

customer_reviews.title: Very fast modem and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I don't buffer anymore when watching 4K Netflix and everything is super responsive. The setup was really kind of neat and did it totally through the phone login service with the Comcast internet service. As advertised, I did just plug it in, had the initial boot-up (took about 10 minutes) and log in. Then good to go. Don't forget you may need to restart your router/AP's after. Came from a very old DOCSIS 3.0 modem and the new one picked up on the 3.1 DOCSIS connection (Blue indicator light).
customer_reviews.author: BATL

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to install, but the instructions are a little miss leading
customer_reviews.text: This Modem was really easy to install, although we did have a lot of trouble to get our airport time capsule router/switch/backup server to connect with it, although that was probably partially user error because of the lack of information surrounding how to setup a airport time capsule, although in the sub-rating section, it says WiFi signal, event though this is just a modem, no router, access point, VPN server, firewall, or any other easily manageable interface that I was able to get to. Another tidbit of information would be that you don’t need the “Ethernet port” icon to be blue, as long as it is green, it should be working. All in all, this is a pretty good modem.
customer_reviews.author: Linda T. Le

customer_reviews.title: Want Gig on Comcast with no problems? Here, buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Want to save the $10/mo from Comcast? Buy this one. It's on their approved equipment list. Too bad Comcast's "representative" boldface lied to my face and told me they had to provide the equipment to get Gbit service. Seriously, what's with that company? Anyways, aside, this is a great product, and we're pushing about 800mbit on a gig service from Comcast on it (the tcp/ip makes this around normal). This was a quick call to activate and works very, very well. If you're looking for a solid product, this is it. Been working non-stop since we plugged it in, and has been rock solid with no reboots or problems.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Best DOCSIS 3.1 modem you can get
customer_reviews.text: The MB8600 is the best docsis 3.1 modem you can get currently. With the correct "LAGG/LACP" setup, hardware configuration this modem is able to max out my gig service with Spectrum. Provisioning at this tier is 1220mbps down and 42mbps up and its able to saturate the connection when using LACP, multi gig router and client . I would say anyone having issues using this modem are running into something unrelated to it. The modem has 100% stable and reliable for me, even if you don't want or can use the LACP option of the MB8600 it would provide maximum throughput at any speed tier.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Cross

customer_reviews.title: Good, until it hard-locks
customer_reviews.text: had this modem for 7 months, now. It worked well up until q month ago when I started noticing signal losses which I attributed to the service provider in the beginning. Discussing this issue with a coworker who had the same model he mentioned that his hard-locked. This is happening to mine now. When it hard-locks there is a loss of internet signal, inability to access either the modem or the router until I reset it. This sometimes happens a couple of time in a day. After 7 months of use I am not sure it would be on my recommended list.
customer_reviews.author: Francis K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, works a treat. Connect cable and power, let it run a couple of minutes. It finds an internet link. Then connecting router and going to the Motorola web site, where the connection and setup with my ISP was completely handled by the site. It even identified the ISP, I didn't have to enter anything but my ISP account number and address for identification. Compared to my last installation several years ago, which took a half-hour on the phone with my ISP, this is freakin' amazing. I also like the illuminated icons -- my last modem just had lights but who could remember what they meant?
customer_reviews.author: video_man

customer_reviews.title: Extremely fast load times
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't really expecting so see any real difference with this modem. I bought this because I realized for some reason I was renting my modem and instead of renting, I always buy. I installed this last night and noticed a huge difference in my page load speeds. My old modem wasn't slow, but I was shocked to see such a difference when loading websites, youtube, etc. Well worth the buy! I would almost compare this to the difference that the SSD made in computers over old standard hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 27 days. Price per day $5.92
customer_reviews.text: I bought it when switched to the new provider (XFINITY). Installed on the 1st of September. Stopped working on 27th. XFINITY service man came to home and verified that modem doew not work anymore. We replaced modem and I am bac on web. I will try to return it to Motorola. I might re-rate it per Motorola's response.
customer_reviews.author: D. Petrovic

customer_reviews.title: Make sure everything is ok on the providers end.
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a scathing review because this pile of garbage didn't deliver. It was glacially slow right out of the box! I lived with that for one day but decided to call Spectrum back to make sure they had done everything that they should have on their end to make this new router perform and lo and behold, they screwed up. They had wrong information in their system and found the trouble. They deleted that info, added the correct info for this router and now I have to say it's blazing fast. As long as I don't have any disconnect problems in the future, i'll be fine with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pavich

customer_reviews.title: This is a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Lower pings and slightly faster speeds, along with stability. Works with Time Warner Spectrum (original Time Warner customer). Set up was easy after calling Time Warner - Spectrum. Unable to get the self install to work, which has been the case with every modem that I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Koch

customer_reviews.title: Works with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older Motorola cable modem. Installed it, called Comcast with the model number, and up and running in an hour. You never get the speed your ISP promises, after all "up to" some number actually means "less than" that number. With this, I'm pretty close. When I first installed it, my speed was quite slow, and I called Motorola support. They identified the Comcast issue, and called Comcast for me. Apparently when Motorola calls Comcast to complain, Comcast actually responded and resolve the issue within an hour. Love that level of customer support from Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Texas65

customer_reviews.title: Activated with Comcast no problem
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought an Arris Surfboard SB8200 but could not get it to activate with Xfinity to save my life. The Motorola MB8600 activated with Xfinity right away. It was totally painless. I get a solid 800+Mbps with it. That's about what I expected, so little reason to doubt this modem can do 1000+Mbps as advertised. So far so good. Just wanted to say if you're looking for a modem for Xfinity, this one seems to work great. == Edit ========== A little over two months after purchase and we have not had a single problem with this modem. We had a couple power outages and after the power came back the modem booted right back up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Greer

customer_reviews.title: Constant connection issues. Can't connect to any http or non secured https
customer_reviews.text: This modem requires a restart about once a day. I've been to tier 3 support with comcast and they can not find anything wrong on their end. Restarting the modem solves the issue about 80% of the time. The issue is that for some reason every connection that is not a SECURED https connection times out. This means you can browse to google, gmail, facebook, netflix, yahoo maybe others but all non secure https or http sites do not load and time out. Once the modem is restarted I usually fixes the issue. This is NOT the only review that has this same problem so it seems like this is not an isolated issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C

customer_reviews.title: It works, and it's fast
customer_reviews.text: I'm one month in after installing this modem. I replaced a Docsis 3.0 Motorola cable modem after Comcast kept nagging me to upgrade. The install was easy, and Comcast recognized it and started working with it quickly. Follow the instructions and they will lead you to success. Speed tests show I'm getting all of what Comcast is offering for my service level. Of course, when my neighbors are asleep. During high traffic times, we still get a good speed. Overall I'm happy. I'll be even happier if I get as many years out of this modem as I did with the last one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Deibler

customer_reviews.title: Super fast! Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded the speed of our internet and needed a better modem. This modem was very easy to install - the directions were wonderful and clear. We have operated nine different devices over Wi-Fi using this modem with no problems at all (TV/Netflix, laptops, tablets, etc). The speed of uploading and downloading is amazing - now I can work from home easily! I highly recommend this product. Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash!  Motorola is not going to last.....
customer_reviews.text: This modem is trash. It requires constant restarts to work. It will drop the speeds constantly until the connection drops all together. It was only moderately stable and then it went out completely. Their tech support is a joke. The agent wouldn't give me any name or identifier. They blamed Cox and said they had rolled out a firmware for Cox recently. He said for some it worked, but for many it is still in the works. I bought a NetGear modem and it worked without issue. Don't waste $150 on a unstable modem that is going stop functioning every time your ISP "changes" something. Motorola is shrinking and going forward I'm staying away from their garbage products.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Laufenberg

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don’t write reviews unfortunately unless they are bad but right out of the box this was garbage it was on the list of compatible with my internet company and my last modem was Motorola so it was a no brainer to me well after hours of rebooting and tech support and new cables I finally just hooked my old clunker back up and ordered a net gear modem over it wish I read the reviews more I’m sure I just got a bad one but too bad no second chances this time
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 8 months and DEAD - no warranty service from MTRLC LLC
customer_reviews.text: Finally getting the speed I’m paying for from Comcast. I replaced an Arris 6190 (Puma chipset) with this and I’m happy with the results. Edit: After 8 months the modem was shot. Comcast tested it. Zero customer service from this seller. Phone call never answered and no response to email. The 2 year warranty is junk unless you buy from a reputable seller. MTRLC LLC is NOT a reputable seller. I had to go to Best Buy and get another modem from them. Couldn't have internet down for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Plain Truth

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a trust worthy brand
customer_reviews.text: Died not even 4 months old would cut out and come back and after paying the cable company tech to rerun new lines in the home did not solve anything tried a company modem worked fine so went out bought a netgear CM1000 and so far haven't had a problem so ..... very disappointed I have had many Motorola cable modems in past never had a problem only had to to replace when newer tech came out to keep up with the cable company sad .........
customer_reviews.author: Soulreaper8402

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $$
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about other Moto models, but this one was very simple to install and works great out of the box. The Wifi signal extends a fair distance (not super great), but enough to easily cover a two story 2200sqft home. Wish I could get Wifi outside when mowing the lawn, but that's not why I bought this. I subscribe to 100mbps internet and this modem pulls in an average of 121mbps at the source. I think this modem was well worth the extra money spent and would recommend it to anyone looking for a simple, strong device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it to work on Comcast in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to work on Comcast in the Houston area after days of trying as well as Comcast technician troubleshooting and visits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's starting to die on me after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for roughly 8 months, and its starting to drop connection intermittently, but on a daily basis. I've ruled out all other possible factors, including the cable, outlet, Comcast's fault, and the router connected to it. Resetting it does nothing, and restarting it only temporarily fixes the issue. It's possible that I got a bad unit, but either way, I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not Xfinity Compatible... Unstable, Always Disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: This modem is not truly Xfinity compatible. Ever since I replaced my cheap ol' Zoom modem (which wasn't Xfinity approved) with this modem which is supposed to be "certified for Comcast XFINITY®," I've had constant disconnection issues. After two technician visits and the replacement of all other physical network media in house and beyond demarc, the problems persist; pointing to an issue with the modem. The last technician to visit said theyve seen a lot of issues with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Colin B.

customer_reviews.title: STUNNINGLY fast modem.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this modem when upgrading to Gigabit internet with Xfinity. I wanted to avoid paying the $15 each month for the rental. The install was pretty easy, with one exception... the modem took about 90 minutes to connect with Xfinity. It takes the normal 5 or so minutes with each restart now, but the initial difficulty is the only reason I’m giving this 4 stars. Other than that... I have clocked download speeds of 924mbps, and upload speeds of 41mbps. It’s stunningly fast, even with a large family and several devices connected at all times. Highly recommend; just know you may have to be patient when making the initial connection.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Xfinity in King County, WA
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a motorola modem that finally died after 6 years of solid operation. Unfortunately, this modem has very inconsistent performance oscillating from 33 Mbps to 300 mbps. From minute to minute. According to Comcast tech support just because it says 'certified for xfinity' does not mean it can handle full-speed operation robustly. If you are paying for more than 33 Mbps, be warned that this modem (despite docsis 3.1 and claims of certification) will not consistently provide full speed internet. Comcast is currently (June 2019) using Arris modems in their gateways in King County, WA. (Can't say where else that applies.)
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Spectrum cable.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with Spectrum (Time Warner) cable. Just hooked it up and called Spectrum Tech Support to change modem MAC address.
customer_reviews.author: LF Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Easy with some tips to help you
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded our service and needed 600 Mbps+. Just make sure to BE PATIENT. Make certain you are DIRECTLY connected to the modem with your computer during setup! You will need to power it up and wait - I needed to login to Xfinity and click "activate modem" in the depths of their stupid website. Just find that, be patient, and it'll work super. No need to switch out a cable you think is bad, or rebooting 12 times, or calling tech support - try this method, and good luck!
customer_reviews.author: I'm a real customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Modem!! - Fast and Stable Connection with Comcast Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: The only negative thing is you can't mount it on the wall like some other models. I have Gigabit service and even after routing through my Nighthawk I am still getting close to Gigabit speed!
customer_reviews.author: Derek A. Bentley

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Happy User
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my older cable modem with this ungraded technology model. Don't have "GB" class internet service, but do have Comcast "400 mega-bit" service. Previous actual wireless download speed was in 8 - 10 mega-byte/s range. Also replaced my existing wireless router with new higher end unit. Now regularly enjoy download speeds of 250 - 300 mega-bits/s, or 30 -38 mega-bytes/s. Can't really notice great benefits from this major acceleration, but I wanted a faster internet and I got it! And that makes me feel good!
customer_reviews.author: Alan S.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - This model has a "known issue"
customer_reviews.text: This modem needs to be reset every couple days to maintain the speeds it claims it is capable of. I spoke with my ISP, and they let me know that there is a "known issue" that supposedly Motorola is working on that causes it to lose connection and need to be reset. Unfortunately the issue didn't really start kicking in until about a month after I bought it. Fortunately Amazon still refunded it even though it was past the 30 day mark (Amazon customer service is awesome).
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Simple setup. Very efficient managing the speed. Using Comcast as provider. I paid for their technicians for installation because they would have to run a cable from the pole. After the cable was installed, the tech had to call in to register the modem. I should have done that ahead of time but I didn't think of it. Besides, I paid the tech for install and he had a back line to tech support to get it registered. That process took about 10 mins. Other than that, no frills, very fast modem. Paying for 250mbs download. Getting between 220 to 240mbs download speeds. (did not factor in time of day, VPN, etc)
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Chan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cable Modem - Charter Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: TLDR: Works great on Charter Spectrum Ultra 1Gig. I am using this modem on my Charter Spectrum 1Gig Ultra service. So far it is working perfectly. I have it connected to my Netgate SG-5100 using two 1Gig links using link aggregation (LACP). This allows me to fully saturate my WAN link. Since most cable ISPs over-provision service I can hit 1.2Gbps down and 40Mbps up. This only works when the speed test uses multiple connections. This is the nature of link aggregation; single transfers will still max out at 940-1000Mbps. Great DOCSIS 3.1 modem that should serve me well until DOCSIS 4.0 becomes a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this modem because of a previous experience with a Motorola modem, which worked really well, and I had no issues with that router. As noted in some of the other one-star reviews, I have to manually reset the router at least once a day. Even the status lights on the front indicate internet connectivity, my devices have no connectivity. After I reset the modem, connectivity is re-established. I haven't yet called Motorola support, but so far, I'm very disappointed in this modem, and cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Coffee

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a network engineer so I wasn't intimidated with this setup at all, but it was pretty simple. The only issue I had was not with the modem, but with my router. I had turned on QoS in my router and apparently it wasn't able to manage QoS at the speeds the modem was capable of pushing, so my bandwidth tests were only showing about 20% of expected. Once I turned QoS off, was getting full speeds from Comcast. Have not had any need to reboot it since I worked past the QoS issue. So it's been running reliably for the past two months now.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B.

customer_reviews.title: Works With Comcast/Xfinity Internet
customer_reviews.text: I have had this up and running for 3 and a half months now. It has been very reliable and keeps the connection very well. It plays nicely with my Apple Extreme router too. So far no complaints. If I do reboot it for whatever reason it is up and running again in under a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Gr Kl

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, future-proof design
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by how easy this was to set up. I especially appreciated that the LEDs change colour depending on which protocol is being used (DOCSIS 3.0 vs 3.1). Instructions are well written and clearly indicate who/how to contact for additional support. The built-in spectrum analyzer is helpful if you have enough understanding to interpret it. The main reason I decided on this model versus competitors was the additional masked ports that make it possible to use link aggregation if/when I can get a plan with speeds greater than 1Gb/s. That means I can use this modem for the next 5-10 years or longer and it will pay for itself several times over.
customer_reviews.author: TechSavvyStudent

customer_reviews.title: 300 MBps vs. 100 MBps previously
customer_reviews.text: Great modem! Future proofed. Comcast recently boosted our speeds in the area for free, but it required a modem upgrade, and conveniently a lightning storm killed my modem via the coaxial cable (yes, I forgot to get a surge protector). So with the new modem, I'm getting 300 MBps vs. 100 MBps previously. Can't complain! And since I bought my own modem, I don't have to pay rental. However, the Comcast folks messed up my boot log and now I can't access Comcast Xfinity hotspots. Will have to waste time calling and speaking with them to update my MAC address again and configure the boot log file on their end.
customer_reviews.author: 杨杰夫

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Comcast Gigabit speeds
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a crappy netgear that I had bought that never booted up right and never got great speeds with. That netgear might have been faulty, but I have had 0 issues with this motorola. I set it up the first day and haven't really touched it since, I this combined with an ubiquiti edgerouter for my home network with my 1GB comcast service. I regult get speeds of around 850-950Mb+ . I am able to achieve full usage of the GB internet speeds which is awesome for downloads. (of course, your download will only be as fast as the hosting provider can upload.) Good modem so far with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Does not seems to work with Apple Airport Time Capsule
customer_reviews.text: Tried to activated this modem on Xfinity with our exiting Apple Airport Time Capsule. The activation process via the Xfinity/activate web page is surprisingly fast. However our Time capsule just can't acquire an IP address via DHCP. It works if I directly connect my MacBook Pro to the ethernet port on the modem, but not for the Time capsule. Also even using direction connection, it takes a long time for it to get a valid dynamic IP, at first I almost thought the activation process is not working.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Huang

customer_reviews.title: Opened Up the Pipeline & Can See the Difference
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem is an easy install, the challenge for me was the connection for modem to get on my account and begin to start working. It took four tries (15-20mins total from unboxing to activation, coulda been waaaay worse), but it got on and am cruising the net. Instead of sites loading, they’re just poppin’ on screen just after entering the web addresses. So to say the upgrade is “noticeable” is saying the least. Glad I bought and made the upgrade to enhance the connection that was a choking point with my previous modem. I also may have to change my router as well to increase my range extension. That’ll be a different review for another product and day.
customer_reviews.author: Telecom Herk

customer_reviews.title: Frequent disconnects - buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I was upgrading to a 250/10 package with my cable provider and thought a motorola modem would be a pretty safe bet for a new DOCSIS 3.1 modem. Unfortunately I was wrong. This thing has steadily gone from bad to worse. What started as a "reboot it once every couple days" is now a "reboot it 4-5 times a day" kind of issue. Cable provider sees no issues. Tried a hard reset, etc. Nothing helps. Looks like I'm just outside my return period with Amazon too so yippee I now get to deal with Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Works for MediaCom gigabit
customer_reviews.text: The installer plugged this in and I had internet connection in under 20 seconds. I verified the speed by connecting directly to the modem with a gigabit ethernet card. Clocked 920 mbps. Good enough for me. Be sure to order a router or access point/router combo, as this is the modem only. Also, the 4 ports are for port bonding OR assigning multiple ip addresses (if you pay Mediacom for it you can get more than one ip address). They are not for connecting multiple computers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MB8600
customer_reviews.text: Took my internet speed from 100 Mbps to 350 Mbps. Speaks for itself, I obviously couldn't be happier. UPDATE: After just over a month, started having connection issues. Conveniently the modem was just out of the return window, so now I'm stuck with a $150 paper weight. So definitely super happy about that. But I bought the Netgear Nighthawk CM1200...just hooked it up, works like a champ so far. If this one decides it doesn't want to work, too, I'm suing the Internet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for Nashville comcast gigabit speeds
customer_reviews.text: Got worse than before, 5mbps. Worked but barely. Way worse than my previous 5 year old modem. Motorola support useless. Said it either works or doesn't. Cannot update firmware. Changed out to a Comcast rental and now at 962 mbps. Sent this one back for refund. Will then go purchase a netgear or some other brand instead of paying a $13 monthly modem rental fee.
customer_reviews.author: OleMissFan

customer_reviews.title: Heed the disconnect warnings and don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for 2 months though I had to restart it about once a week. Now I’m having frequent disconnect issues - about 10 times just today. And I work from home and use streaming services for TV so reliability is huge for me. Based on prior reviews, and the fact that it’s outside the return window, I’ll be trashing it and buying a much cheaper one from my internet provider that has better reliability.
customer_reviews.author: RLY811

customer_reviews.title: Died within 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Had been using this cable for 6 months with no real issue. Within the past two months, I had to reboot the modem occasionally to fix connectivity issues. The other night, the modem all but died. The only thing it would do is power on: I could not access the status web page from my intranet, my ISP could not see the modem, and the connectivity indicators did not blink. Since my wife and I are working from home, we can't afford to wait for Motorola to ship a replacement modem to us. So, I went to a local electronics store to buy a different model from a different brand name.
customer_reviews.author: M. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Best Modem for 2017
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic modem, extremely easy to install and setup. This is a great modem, I purchased the Motorola after returning the Aris SB8200. The Aris ran extremely hot but my main issue was that it kept dropping my connection and restarting. The Motorola has worked flawlessly since day one. Not only has it not dropped my connection but it barely gets warm. We have about 15 different electronics connected online this modem along with out Asus router is a perfect match. No lag, no dropped signal, no bottleneck. Just smooth fast internet for everyone in the home. I would definitely buy this modem again and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Shield

customer_reviews.title: The ISP Overlords Made Me Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: It's fast and snazzy. Bought after I was told by my cable internet provider overlords that I needed to upgrade my 4x4 DOCSIS 3 modem. Seems to work pretty well. Looking forward to the fact that I can upgrade my connection all the way to 1gig fiber with this bad boy. I'm a heavy gamer and so far between my wife gaming, myself gaming and streaming Netflix while on the long-winded quests of the Broken Isle--all at the same time, it's kept up and performed well. I suppose I could upgrade to a higher end modem, but it's a Motorola, it'll last forever. Unless of course the ISP cons tell me otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Support is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it worked fine, till it didn't. It was still under warranty so contacted Motorola. After almost 2 months they finally said they can't RMA the modem as they don't have any replacements they can send me. Told me to send it back to them and they would issue me a refund of my purchase price. 3 weeks later no refund either. Edit: Finally got the full refund. Spent it on an Arris modem to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Noonan

customer_reviews.title: Successor to the venerable Surfboard.  Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I could go on and on about how I have tons of professional experience with networks and all that nonsense, but I won't. I bought this modem because screw paying Comcast any more than I have to. This thing works excellent, had it for several months with no problems. My throughput is always exactly what it should be. This thing supports a ton of features that 99% of you will never use. Just know that for a cable modem it is probably the best one I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Masters

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my modem!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my Xfinity internet speed to 1000mbps (gigabit) and my router could handle the speed, but not my modem. So I picked up the Motorola MB8600 and it's been working great! When my desktop computer is wired in I'm getting up to 1300 mbps download and 42mbps upload. Wifi download speed on my iPhone X is about 414 mbps and 41 mbps upload. Setting up was simple. I turned my router off, plugged the new modem in, reset my router, turned my router and modem on and then went to xfinity.com/activate and that was it. I have nothing bad to say about this modem, very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use modem, nice transitions from my Xfinity rental modem.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace my rented Xfinity (Arris TG1682G) modem, and got it going today with a bit of help from Xfinity technical support. This device doesn't have WiFI, so I also purchased the Motorola MR1900. The transition to the modem was relatively painless... As I mentioned, I had to call Xfinity for technical support to complete the transition, but they were able to make it work. I still have to return my rental to stop getting charges, but the switchover is something I should have done years ago. The Motorola products are solid, fast and full featured for everything I need to do - so I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Streaming @Docsis 3.1
customer_reviews.text: Cut the cable recently and installed 5 Roku’s at home. My old 100 Mbs internet was getting the herky jerky’s when everyone was online. Upped my Internet connection to 400 Mbs and found my old modem was obsolete so Rather than rent a modem for 10 bucks a month. I did the research and found the the new standard for modem protocol is 3.1. The Motorola MB8600 replaced my SB6121 and speeds went up over 4x even the Spectrum tech was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: It's modem
customer_reviews.text: There really isn't that much to say about this thing. I didn't get the model with wifi so it is what it is. It was pretty easy to set up. It's big. Bigger than I would like. I got used to the older surfboard modems which are a lot smaller. I haven't notice any significant improvement in throughput but it does work and, most importantly, it connected straight off to my firewall which I guess means it is pre-configured for bridged mode... a good thing. There might be better modems out there but I'm not really going to go buy a few of these for comparisons sake. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Susceptible to power surges
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it worked great. Unfortunately it appears that it is susceptible to power surges. Even with a surge protector. I have had many cable modems through the years and this is the first one that died due to a power surge or thunderstorm. All of my other electronics are still working just fine after the last thunderstorm, except this one. Which is arguably the most important one as I depend in the Internet for work at this time. Over $220 later ($70 service call and $150 For a different modem) I have Internet again. It is an expensive lesson indeed. I should have just kept my Docsis 3.0 modem.
customer_reviews.author: K Angel

customer_reviews.title: Replaced one of the faulty Intel Puma chips
customer_reviews.text: When I bought my modem, over a year ago now, I didn't not know about the puma chip issues. I've been having so many latency issues, thought it was cable co. Friend was asking me about purchasing his own modem to avoid the monthly costs. I was looking at what I bought and a nice amazon reviewer shared the Puma chipset issue. Like it totally explained all my problems. I usually go with Broadcom chipsets in my routers/modems. Wish I had. So far this has been awesome. I'm not even on 1gb (just 400mb) and it still connects as 3.1 and 3.0. So afr so good. No latency/dropped packet issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: MCT

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We chose this Motorola modem from our cable provider’s list of approved and compatible products. Three months later the modem failed to complete the download connection. Our isp has documented numerous failures with this particular model. Reconnecting our 3.0 Motorola modem returned internet service. Motorola’s customer service department stopped helping us when we requested a replacement modem. I just purchased an Arris Surfboard SB8200, an expensive goodbye to Motorola...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: Comcast recommended that I upgrade my modem, picked this one. Had issues from the start. We would be up for several days, then connectivity would go in and out. Many calls to Comcast did not resolve, the connection would come back and no issues found. I replaced my wireless thinking this would help. Finally, 10 days after 30 day return had no connectivity, finally someone at Comcast phone service verified the modem was failing. Going to give Motorola a chance for service. Not hopeful. I know things fail and not all is perfect, so I only give this a bad rating as I unfortunately got a bad apple. If Motorola works this out I will adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Johnson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Utter garbage. 1st one lasted 3 months. Then started to slow down. Comcast kept saying their signal was good to it. Finally swapped to 7 year old modem and it worked again. Had to pay return shipping to get another modem. This one lasted 12 months. Haven't even tried to talk to them again. Motorola is utter garbage, sad a once great company makes a device that costs a ton and doesn't last.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wielgus

customer_reviews.title: Works great with WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect with WOW! I did a lot of research for a WOW compatible modem, and on the most powerful modems. This one works great! I called WOW to double check first and they said any modem with DOCIS 3.0 or 3.1 works. I plugged it into the wall hooked up the cable, plugged my router into the modem & done! Easy peasy Great signal!
customer_reviews.author: firekracker

customer_reviews.title: Works with Optimum Online
customer_reviews.text: I just hooked this up today with Optimum Online. I was expecting it to go into DOCSIS 3.0 mode but according to the color of the light its running in DOCSIS 3.1 Mode - which is interesting. That being said it is functioning perfectly and all speed tests so far and showing better speeds than when I was using the AlticeOne box. I went with this modem due to the fact it doesn't use a Puma chipset. I definitely recommend this modem.
customer_reviews.author: alexander

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: Since I didn't intend to pay $10 a month to rent a modem from Mediacom, I told them we'd provide our own. They said that would be fine provided it was met the DOCSIS 3.1 standard, which eliminated the less expensive model I had planned to get. I think this was the only DOCSIS 3.1 modem available, so it wasn't a hard choice, but we plugged it in and it worked perfectly right off the bat. We're paying for 60 Mbps and getting 79, so we can't complain! (Well, we could complain about three cable outages in the past three weeks, but that's not the fault of the modem.)
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne S. Barnhill

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, get an Arris sb8200 or a Netgear cm1000 for docsis 3.1
customer_reviews.text: Modem only stays connected for about 30 minutes, then all lights turn off except power and LAN; I ran a continuous ping to the modem and when this state happens it starts dropping all pings. I was actually excited about this product because Motorola hasn't made a modem since they sold the licensing rights of the surfBORED to Arris; I was hopping they would come back into the market with a really good product, but I guess they're just using their name to sell junk. Sad times.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Krautheim

customer_reviews.title: You'd never believe your internet could be so fast
customer_reviews.text: It takes a big improvement to make you want to dig into your closet and upgrade your networking hardware, but the shift from 100Mbps cable to 1Gpbs cable is one of those improvements you should run towards. The motorola modem comes future proofed (up to 4gbps with hidden ethernet ports), comes with an extra ethernet cord, cable wrench and cable tie, and the easiest to use instruction manual with specific instructions for all american cable providers. A great product to pair with your Eero wifi system!
customer_reviews.author: miradu

customer_reviews.title: Great well thought modem.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a DOCSIS 3.0 and was getting 120mbps out of the 150mbps, not too shabby using COX. I switched to this cable modem and it came up connecting at DOCSIS 3.1. Now I'm getting 181mbps out of 150mbps. What not to like? It comes with 4 ethernet ports that can be linked together to get up to 4gps of data throughput when cable operator will provide them. So far so good. It replaces a 8 years old modem which served me well and I am happy with the results. Also, I feel like it will be future proof for a while until 10gb fiber is available.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchyaz

customer_reviews.title: Nice modem for a few months
customer_reviews.text: The unit installed easily and worked well until this month. It stopped. I did every thing to fix per manufacturers instructions including a full reset. It recycles about every 10-15 seconds. i connected to different locations in house and no deal. I even checked the power supply for proper output.. it was fine. Oh well, I'm stuck with it because to much time has gone by for a return.
customer_reviews.author: Adam A. Crews

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  940mbps down and 40mbps up!  Easy to install and very reliable!  A+
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a Comcast service area and have historically had my own cable modem. I came from a Mediacom area and did not have the DOCSIS 3.1 gigabit plan available. I bought the MB8600 + EERO PRO 3 pack and set up in about 30 minutes. I have 1000mbps download service for $84.99/month with my own modem and great coverage throughout the home. We are located in a poor cellular area (one bar LTE signal on Verizon!) and this setup works perfectly for VZW Wi-Fi calling. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Not RCN Compatible
customer_reviews.text: Despite statements in the user manual and suggested throughout the product description, the modem is confirmed not RCN compatible. When reached out to Motorola tech support, received one sentence response stating, no it’s not RCN compatible. Given there are many other docsis 3.1 modem, save the hassle and get something else that is truly compatible to most major ISP providers.
customer_reviews.author: T. Liang

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be working just fine
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old Motorola cable modem in order for me to get higher bandwidth rates. I connected it and waited for the system to communicate with Comcast "central'. Once that was done... I followed the directions to add a modem to my account. This all worked without a phone call or chat with Comcast. Anytime I can avoid talking to support... I am happy. My DL speeds when up to 180 mbps which is fine since I have the 150 plan. The older modem could not provide more than low 100s. Anyhow I am ready for the future of internet bandwidth :-)
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: A cable modem that works
customer_reviews.text: There is not much to say about this. I connected it to the cable, it worked. After 2 months we have had one failure which was when Comcast was doing some work outside and I had to turn off / on the modem to reset the network. One word of caution, this modem does NOT allow you to connect a phone line. It is internet phone capable (which is different), but Comcast in my area offers phone service as well, and this modem does not support that type of connection. A bit confusing, but at the end of the day, it does internet perfect, which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.Top Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Second one I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these several years ago when Comcast obsoleted my former cable modem. Unfortunately it recently died. I was not happy about that but since owning it still saved me money over the cost to rent a modem from Comcast I decided it had still been an OK purchase. Talking with Comcast's top tech support guy in our area about what to replace it with, he suggested this modem was probably still a good buy with features that will support the changes Comcast plans to make in the future. This time I bought the optional extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Rayburn

customer_reviews.title: Announced and released with four ports with the model number and removed 3 ports
customer_reviews.text: Announced and released with four ports with the model number and removed the ports and kept one port. Browse the reviews this verses competitor model everyone has a higher rate because of the number of ports but MOTOROLA reduce the port from 4 to 1 and enjoy the benefit of the favorable reviews based on the port number
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup - Rock Solid to Date
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to replace my Arris Docsis 3.0 cable modem - which Comcast "end of lifed" with no notification. Installation was straightforward and actually very simple. I was expecting to have to call Comcast support and give them all the pertinent data on the modem - emac -cmac and so forth, but the modem directly connected me to Comcast's modem activation site and within a couple of minutes I was locked in and online. Has been rock solid for 4 days now, and showing connected at Docsis 3.1.
customer_reviews.author: RPM

customer_reviews.title: Great for 18 months then died
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 18 months but died. We started having intermittent outages and had to eliminate our ISP and then WiFi before finding that one of the channels was failing. Had to buy another so went with a cheaper Arris docsis 3.0 which can also do 1GB downloads and is working like a charm. Only option now is to drop off at the electronics recycling center.
customer_reviews.author: Crow T Robot

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid modem
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an Arris modem that had to be reset three/four times a day after it was hit in a power outage.. Purchased this modem (SB8600) after reading online and amazon reviews that it is top of the line. I only have 60 mb service but wanted motorola quality. Had to call Mediacom to register it as their online registration didn't seem to like it was my own modem. Registered no problem and has given me steady, fast, no lag internet service for over a week now on all my devices. (Linksys wireless router and 8 port gigabit switch/hub).
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Works seamlessly
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, after a couple months. I installed this new Gig compatible router on my Xfinity account. I have a 300MB line, but I was only getting about 200 with my old Motorola modem, which prompted me to upgrade. Installation and activation was extremely easy, I didn't have to do much other than follow the instructions. It had to reboot a couple times before it won't online. It has worked seamlessly for a couple months now, without the need for any intervention. I have not had to reboot the modem even once so far. I could be not be happier with the choice for now.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kiyak

customer_reviews.title: Great, then it died.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great while it lasted. With Comcast Gigabit service I was able to pull 940/41 with this thing. Never had any disconnects that I can remember and functioned for a few months without a reboot. A week ago or so it just randomly stopped connecting altogether. It would not lock any channels after multiple resets. I am always skeptical and figured Comcast messed something up, however when I connected and activated an old Zoom 5341j it worked no problem. Reactivated this guy again and still nothing. Now I guess I have to wait weeks and go through a warranty replacement process...
customer_reviews.author: Jared Ross Sabre

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the ass
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of Apple Extreme routers and this thing just does not work with them. I tried to get support from Motorola but a 45 minute wait does not cut it for me. It worked fine with a single computer but I needed more. Be very sure that your routers will work with it. It also took a long time to get recognised by the Comcast Cable system when I started the modem up. All in all, not Motorola's finest hour.
customer_reviews.author: Mike O'R

customer_reviews.title: The UI is easy to use if you choose to use it (most ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this with my gigabit service from Comcast, it works quite well. It doesn't seem to throw off as much heat as the smaller form-factor Arris models I used in the past. The UI is easy to use if you choose to use it (most people don't). Setup via Comcast was trivial, you plug it in and go to their activate walled-garden (activate.comast.net or maybe it was comcast.net/activate) -- or you can just call the MAC address into their voice tech support.
customer_reviews.author: ems

customer_reviews.title: I have not had to reboot as others indicated so that is a good thing. This was a well priced product and ...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to Cox Ultimate and wanted to future proof if Gigablast comes into my area - I noticed about a 10% speed increase over my still working surfboard DOCSIS 3.0 modem. I have not had to reboot as others indicated so that is a good thing. This was a well priced product and works as it should. I'll get with my cable provider to see if the lack of their advertised speed is due to their line or connection when the weather warms up.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Should have heeded the warnings of others. (maybe not as 8/30/2019)
customer_reviews.text: Yeah they got me on this one. I have to reboot it daily. Constantly loses connection to the internet. Very frustrating. Looking for something else but not sure. Using cat5e, 5 locations in my house. Getting 20-25 down 7-12 up. 21 devices on my network, including an Apple Extreme WiFi. When it is connected it works well. Any tech advise is appreciated. UPDATE!! After updating the firmware on my router, I am now getting the full effect of this modem. Downloads now 300+ uploads 20+.
customer_reviews.author: MrOllie75

customer_reviews.title: Replaces Spectrum Modem. See details.
customer_reviews.text: This was used to replace a Spectrum Modem, and works perfectly fine. IMPORTANT to know this is a Modem ONLY. Not a Router. Not a Wi-Fi Router. JUST A MODEM! This means in addition to this modem you will also need a Router or a Wi-Fi Router. I am using a LUXUL Epic 4 Router with a LUXUL WAP system. In addition I also use a Panamax BlueBOLT IP Power Management system to reboot the entire network weekly. This system is reliable, robust and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Darren M.

customer_reviews.title: If you need the speed, this Motorola has the goods!
customer_reviews.text: If your ISP provides the proper signal this modem delivers the goods. My ISP came out and verified my infrastructure supported gigspeed internet before I purchased this Docsis 3.1 modem, and so I bought it. I hooked it up, gave them a call, told the the mac address, and within 15 minutes had download speeds (wired) of between 800-900Mbs. solid as a rock! Capable of channel bonding in the future should your ISP go there. If you need the speed, this Motorola has the goods!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Logan

customer_reviews.title: Does not have Wifi
customer_reviews.text: this product worked fine, however you have to also have a Router to use it. I did not know and ended up having to go out and buy one. I used it with xfinity, and then their customer service said that they could not test my wifi speed because they could not see through the modem to the router. So I had to return it. Xfinity customer service is horrible, but that's another story
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: More speed after technology upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Xfinity internet blast 150Mbps Old (2011) Motorola MB 6120 modem: Speedtest 138 Mbps down 12 Mbps up New (2018) Motorola MB 8600 modem: Speedtest 179 Mbps down 12 Mbps up The installation of the new modem was quick and easy BUT I needed to call comcast because the self activation on the internet was not working! A couple minutes later and the new modem was running fast and with no issues. I’m happy for now with the new modem and technology.
customer_reviews.author: Olli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade for Spectrum internet
customer_reviews.text: This modem is not currently supported by Spectrum. I was able to install it with the help of Spectrum tech support. It is on their list. This modem is capable of 300 mbps internet connection but Spectrum requires that everybody uses their modem. This modem also use up to 3 channels if your router will support it. Very little tech support. Basically Motorola wants the internet carrier to do the support. Not much in the way of tweeking using the internet based control panel.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Although good, the interface and manual smells of arrogance
customer_reviews.text: The login page is trash. The user name field wipes itself when you navigate to another tab or app. This is for HOME use damnit. Besides the comcast phone number in their instructions is wrong. Their web site in the instructions is wrong. Seriously Motorola can build AWESOME hardware, but their software and documentation is ALWAYS crap. I remember the friggin Motorola Windows CE devices. PS Comcast requires you to call now.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D

customer_reviews.title: Second attempt
customer_reviews.text: My initial attempt to connect the modem with my ISP (Cox) failed. While it seemed to provision with the ISP, my router would not connect. I was about to return it, but after a few days, I tried again and another tech was able to get it working. During the past few days, the issues I had with drops have gone away. Guess it was time to retire the old modem.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I bought a bad one for the second time
customer_reviews.text: Duo, now I had to get Xfinity’s expensive monthly bill for ‘their modem-router’ because this magnificent product shows that it’s solidly connected to the internet but wouldn’t feed to my enormous appetite for WiFi and internet ‘juice’! Horrible! Then, when I checked my used modems and routers, we already had been through one of the exact modem. I dentical! Never again! I’ll just live with this Xfinity equipment because my wife works from home and we no longer are having any issues.
customer_reviews.author: EddySnow

product_meta.title: MOTOROLA MB8600 DOCSIS 3.1 Cable Modem, 6 Gbps Max Speed. Approved for Comcast Xfinity Gigabit, Cox Gigablast, and More
feature_bullets: TOP INTERNET SPEEDS FOR ALL CABLE INTERNET SERVICES - Wirecutter recommends this as the best cable modem for people using Gigabit Internet plans. Built-in DOCSIS 3.1 and DOCSIS 3.0 32x8 capabilities give top Internet speeds for all cable Internet services, from the slowest to the fastest.

ELIMINATE UP TO 156 DOLLARS PER YEAR IN CABLE MODEM RENTAL FEES. (Savings are shown for Comcast Xfinity and vary by cable service provider.) Approved by Comcast Xfinity and Xfinity X1, Cox, and CableOne for all speeds including Comcast Gigabit services and Cox Gigablast. Not compatible with RCN. No cable modem is compatible with fiber optic, DSL, or satellite services, available from Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, Frontier, and others.)

WORKS WITH ANY WiFi ROUTER YOU LIKE - including Whole Home WiFi or Mesh routers like eero, Google WiFi, and Orbi. This cable modem does NOT have a built-in wireless router or telephone call capability.

A BROADCOM CHIPSET PROVIDES SECURITY FROM DENIAL OF SERVICE ATTACKS - a 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet port allows connection of any SINGLE device with an Ethernet port including a router, Windows or Mac computer, HDTV, or game station.

ACTIVE QUEUE MANAGEMENT (AQM) SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCES INTERNET LATENCY - on both DOCSIS 3.1 and 3.0 services. AQM results in faster page loads for all Web traffic and greatly enhances interactive applications like online gaming and video conferencing. The MB8600 also includes a full-band capture digital tuner to enhance speed and save energy.
